Proverbs__01.1: The parables of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel.
Proverbs__01.3: To understand the words of prudence: and to receive the instruction of doctrine, justice, and judgment, and equity:
Proverbs__01.4: To give subtilty to little ones, to the young man knowledge and understanding.
Proverbs__01.5: A wise man shall hear and shall be wiser: and he that understandeth, shall possess governments.
Proverbs__01.6: He shall understand a parable, and the interpretation, the words of the wise, and their mysterious sayings.
Proverbs__01.7: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. Fools despise wisdom and instruction.
Proverbs__01.8: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
Proverbs__01.9: That grace may be added to thy head, and a chain of gold to thy neck.
Proverbs__01.10: My son, if sinners shall entice thee, consent not to them.
Proverbs__01.11: If they shall say: Come with us, let us lie in wait for blood, let us hide snares for the innocent without cause:
Proverbs__01.12: Let us swallow him up alive like hell, and whole as one that goeth down into the pit.
Proverbs__01.13: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoils.
Proverbs__01.14: Cast in thy lot with us, let us all have one purse.
Proverbs__01.15: My son, walk not thou with them, restrain thy foot from their paths.
Proverbs__01.16: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.
Proverbs__01.17: But a net is spread in vain before the eyes of them that have wings.
Proverbs__01.18: And they themselves lie in wait for their own blood, and practise deceits against their own souls.
Proverbs__01.19: So the wage of every covetous man destroy the souls of the possessors.
Proverbs__01.20: Wisdom preacheth abroad, she uttereth her voice in the streets:
Proverbs__01.21: At the head of multitudes she crieth out, in the entrance of the gates of the city she uttereth her words, saying:
Proverbs__01.22: O children, how long will you love childishness, and fools covet those things which are hurtful to themselves, and the unwise hate knowledge?
Proverbs__01.23: Turn ye at my reproof: behold I will utter my spirit to you, and will shew you my words.
Proverbs__01.24: Because I called, and you refused: I stretched out my hand, and there was none that regarded.
Proverbs__01.25: You have despised all my counsel, and have neglected my reprehensions.
Proverbs__01.26: I also will laugh in your destruction, and will mock when that shall come to you which you feared.
Proverbs__01.27: When sudden calamity shall fall on you, and destruction, as a tempest, shall be at hand: when tribulation and distress shall come upon you:
Proverbs__01.28: Then shall they call upon me, and I will not hear: they shall rise in the morning and shall not find me:
Proverbs__01.29: Because they have hated instruction and received not the fear of the Lord,
Proverbs__01.30: Nor consented to my counsel, but despised all my reproof.
Proverbs__01.31: Therefore they shall eat the fruit of their own way, and shall be filled with their own devices.
Proverbs__01.32: The turning away of little ones shall kill them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
Proverbs__01.33: But he that shall hear me, shall rest without terror, and shall enjoy abundance, without fear of evils.
